item.title: Vandalism to pedestrian crossing., 29th August
item.description:
White parts of pedestrian crossing outside of primary school have political graffiti painted on them which is intimidating to local people.

item.title: 3 large wheelie bins blocking pavement every Wednesday, 29th August
item.description:
3 wheelie bins are regularly left out on the pavement which are restricting disabled access and general space on the footpath. Previously reported and nothing has changed, been like it for months now. Location as per map.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slip Trip Hazard On Pavement., 29th August
item.description:
There are two dips in the pavement and one is quite deep. The dips are collecting rain water and leaves and could cause someone to trip, fall if not repaired. Please see photos attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kynaston Road, Sundridge, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 29th August
item.description:
A Silver Volvo Estate (Reg: GJ06 UWW) appears to have been abandoned on A21 Hastings Road Bromley Common. It's on the roadside, adjacent to Barham Court. The offside rear tyre has a puncture and the vehicle is in quite poor condition. The vehicle has been left unattended now for several weeks and hasn't moved from its fixed position.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Church Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Light Head has been turned through 90 degrees, 29th August
item.description:
Once again the traffic light head on the west side of the High Street has been turned through 90 degrees so that it is now facing the Partridge Pub instead of facing down the High Street towards the Magistrates Court. This is the the 5/6th time I have had to report an issue here over the last 18 months or so. It needs a permanent soulution to ths problem of vandalism.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Flags on street lights, 29th August
item.description:
The displaying of flags on public streets has been orchestrated by neo-Nazi and far-right organisations. This is not a display of pride but a deliberate attempt to intimidate non-white residents. They should be removed as they pose a threat to community cohesion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shooters Hill, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for Collection of Abandoned Mattress and Furniture, 29th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chapman Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent cracked, uneven and broken pavements, 29th August
item.description:
Hello, I have reported broken and cracked, uneven pavements several times. The whole pavement as you enter Friars Mews and walk down staring from 1 Friars Mews turning into the large car park area the pavements all the way down on both sides of the road are uneven, cracked and broken. This is a hazard and waiting for accidents to occur. Elderly people live here and they are having to cautiously walk here so that they don't trip or fall. Please have these all checked and repaired. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friars Mews, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Gray's Inn Road, Holborn, London
